data.title: Books Collecting Dust on My Bedside Table
data.meta_description: “Each man is questioned by life; and he can only answer to life by answering for his own life; to life he can only respond by being responsible.” A friend excitedly promoted the book to me as the…
data.text:
“Each man is questioned by life; and he can only answer to life by answering for his own life; to life he can only respond by being responsible.”

– Viktor Frankl

There is a book sitting on my bedside table collecting dust.

A friend excitedly promoted the book to me as the best one she had ever read. She insisted I read it as it changed her life.

Under that book are a few others with the same story. Along with this ever-growing stack, I keep a list of books, movies, and shows recommended to me by others. As well, there is my Amazon book wishlist.

I love to share books and movies that moved me. But I learned long ago that what I like and what works for me doesn’t usually work for others.

We like to share our must-try recommendations with others. This approach isn’t limited to books and movies. We do this with everything.

The list includes but is not limited to chia seeds, travel, monogamy, polyamory, Jesus, Buddha, this book, that book, green drinks, life coach, get a puppy, drop your life coach, meditation, pottery, veganism, pilates, Ayurvedic treatments, probiotics, move to Sweden, move to…
